info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 11:10AM EDT until April 6 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio...
Wills Creek At Cambridge affecting Guernsey County.
Tuscarawas River Above New Philadelphia affecting Tuscarawas County.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio...
Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County.
Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Tuscarawas River above New Philadelphia.
* WHEN...Until Sunday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Water reaches outbuilding of one mobile home on Pine Lane. At 8.0 feet, Water begins to affect several mobile homes along Pine Lane. The ballfields at Waterworks Field Recreation Area are flooded. Water overspreades parking lot of Smith's Dairy at the end of Cookson Avenue.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 7.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight to 7.1 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.6 feet on 06/14/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING
